comments.body: might be best to just inline this
I'd like to keep this because it's used in 7 places and the name `_canUpdateSemanticsChild` makes the purpose of key comparison clearer than `if (oldChild.key == newChild.key)`.

I'm worried that we might be conflating "focused" with "currently being edited", which on touch screens are two different things ðŸ˜• But I think short of a big API change, this ship might have sailed.
How are they different on touch screens? We do make a pretty strong difference between input focus (which is what this is) and accessibility focus.
On non-touch screens a text field would enter focused state immediately, while on touch screens it needs to be activated. But yeah, if focus and accessibility focus are separated, then we're good.
